column4: I wouldn't do it that way around, but I'm too new to ubuntu to know if doing it the right way aroun works reliably.
specifically, I'd purge the meta package and rely on (auto?)clean to wipe the rest
(I wouldn't do what pepperjack said because it's quite reasonable to have some qt or even kde apps installed while using gnome)

the system does have a separate list of packages you explicitly installed (versus ones pulled in as dependencies) and is capable of automatically cleaning up unused dependencies, but the way that works is a bit confusing to this newbie (there's more than one list depending on which frontend you use...)
